titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Willard Bartlett Papers

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: New York lawyer and judge. Bartlett was an associate of Elihu Root.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, diaries and notebooks, and legal briefs of Willard Bartlett. There are 150 letters from Elihu Root to Willard Bartlett. Also, correspondence by and relating to the Bartlett and Buffum families.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: Boxes 20-30. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Willard Bartlett Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fleming, John F. Cataloged 04/03/89 Christina Hilton Fenn

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
